definition: Michelangelo Buonarroti (1475-1564), Renaissance painter and sculptor

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Michelangelo, who based much of his art on the nude figure, here revels in massed drapery.
sentences.chinese: 这是我对米开朗基罗这付作品的美艺说明。

sentences.english: Because of these interruptions, Michelangelo worked on the tomb for 40 years.
sentences.chinese: 由于这些中断，米开朗基罗在坟茔工作了40年。

sentences.english: And the image is much more specifically of Michelangelo's Pieta.
sentences.chinese: 这一幕像极了米开朗基罗的圣母哀子像。

sentences.english: Michaelangelo is the master of the whirling nunchakus.
sentences.chinese: 米开朗基罗是耍双节棍的高手。

sentences.english: The Sistine Chapel ceiling painted by Michelangelo.
sentences.chinese: 西斯廷教堂的棚顶的绘画由米开朗基罗绘制。

sentences.english: He was just trying to paint well; he couldn't help painting like Michelangelo.
sentences.chinese: 他只是想画好，他无法画得不像米开朗基罗。

definition: Leonardo da Vinci (1452-1519), Italian Renaissance painter
Jean Auguste Dominique Ingres (1780-1867), French Neoclassical painter
Giovanni Boccaccio (1313-1375), Italian writer, poet, and humanist, author of Decameron 十日談|十日谈[Shi2 ri4 Tan2]
Donatello (c. 1386-1466)/Donato di Niccolò di Betto Bardi, famous early Renaissance painter and sculptor
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Parthenon Temple on the Acropolis, Athens
the Last Supper (in the Christian Passion story)
